main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over Indian Lake, Ohio, on June 8, 1954, described as a balloon that suddenly sped up, hesitated, and then disappeared.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10-15 minutes and the object was estimated to be about 200 feet in diameter., The object emitted no sound and moved with a 'rocking' or 'wobbling' motion., A witness, who had experience observing aircraft, confirmed that the object was unlike any known aircraft., Another sighting occurred on June 24, 1954, involving a bright light traveling at approximately 1,000 mph., Local Air Force authorities investigated the sighting but could not determine an explanation.
sighted object: unidentified flying object (described as a balloon)
witness description: a person with experience observing aircraft at night
